intro: Cynoglossum anchusoides subsp. asperum, commonly known as rough bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often rough to the touch. The plant produces showy violet-blue flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and rocky areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural habitats.
